title: City Hall to vet all city askaris in new Bill - Nairobi News
text:
City Hall to vet all city askaris in new Bill Posted on Feb 28, 2017 7479 Views City askaris during the 'Operation Clamp Down' against land rates defaulters on Koinange Street. PHOTO | FILE By LILIAN MUTAVI 
Nairobi government will vet all the inspectorate officers if a new Bill allowing the creation of the Nairobi City County Inspectorate Service at the county assembly is passed. 
The Nairobi City County Inspectorate Service Bill 2017 is meant to allow the creation of a new department that will to deal with the conduct of the inspectorate, hiring, training, budget and also disciplining of the county security officers. 
The Bill will see county inspectorate hired before the commencement of the Act become members of the inspectorate service and will be ranked according to the new units created as the board shall designate. 
However that will not bar them from been vetted afresh for the board to ascertain their suitability to continue with service in compliance with chapter six of the Constitution. Latest Stories
